课程编码：162MX002Z 英文名称：Fundamental Biomedical Signal Processing 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：王丽瑾等

教学目的要求
The first part of this course introduces topics in linear algebra and calculus, which will be employed in the second part of the course as well as in other courses in the master study. We begin with a review of vector and matrix algebra and continue with orthogonality and eigen-decompositions. We review basic integration and differentiation techniques and introduce ordinary differential equations and constrained optimization. This part also also covers trigonometry, complex numbers and Fourier analysis.
The other part of the course covers basic topics from Digital Signal Processing and Analysis. Firstly, basic tools in Signal Processing will be introduced, e.g. discrete time signals, Shannons Sampling Theorem, convolution and FIR, IIR filters and spectra. This will be followed by an introduction to basic tools from Stochastic Signal Processing, including autocorrelation and Power Spectrum Density. The course is concluded with basic image processing methods, which are useful when analyzing neuroimaging data.
The course will make use of the MATLAB programming environment when working with the different topics in the course. Therefore, the course will include an introduction to MATLAB to provide participants a basic understanding of the MATLAB programming environment including the use of MATLAB functions, performing matrix operations, visualizing data, and perform simple scripts.

预修课程
Knowledge and some practical experience with vector- and matrix algebra, derivatives and integrals

教材
Engineering Mathematics by Croft, Davison, Hargreaves, Prentice Hall
Biosignal and Biomedical Image Processing, “John L. Semmlow”, Marcel Dekker, Inc. 2004.

课程编码：163MX003Z 英文名称：Research Methods 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
The aim of module 3 is to give students a fundamental knowledge, understanding, and skills in scientific paradigms and methodologies (quantitative and qualitative) and their application (selection and use) when investigating scientific and practical problems.
Following the successful completion of the module the students will be able to:
1. Define and compare alternative scientific paradigms and designs
2. Define and discuss strengths and weaknesses of alternative methods for data collection and analysis.
3. Apply scientific methods in exercises and projects
4. Define and compare alternative scientific paradigms and designs
5. Define and discuss strengths and weaknesses of alternative methods for data collection and analysis.
6. Apply scientific methods in exercises and projects

预修课程

教材

主要内容
The course serves as an opportunity for the students to hone their skills in quantitative and qualitative research methods and methodological considerations in relation to conducting academic research and writing academic projects. The course connects with the meta-theoretical context for discussing and developing academic research. The central argument is that justifications of inferences and warranted assertions depend on the interconnections between research questions, theory, research design and analysis and that the coherence of these interconnections – philosophically and methodologically – are crucial in order to design and conduct research projects that create valid and reliable knowledge. In particular, the importance of the practical skills involved in carrying out research will be emphasized throughout.

The course will provide students with insights in the following main areas:
1. How to plan and carry out survey studies, interviews and ethnographic fieldwork
2. How to develop pertinent research questions which take into account theory, philosophy of science, and methodological considerations
3. How to select the most appropriate research design and match research questions with theory, philosophy of science, data collection methods and modes of analysis
4. The methodological considerations involved in case studies and comparative research

The course will focus on research design, methodology, qualitative research and quantitative research methods. The course comprises four sections. The first section consists of lectures on core issues in methodology, including the interconnections between research questions, research design, use of theory in design, analysis and inference, and ways of doing inference and warranted assertions. The three following sections concern three different core methods in social science and business studies: ethnographic methods, interview methods and survey methods. Each section will include lectures, group work, and practical exercises. The students will, in their project groups, carry out a mini project within each of the three method sections, drawing on the research question(s) and object of research set out for their First Semester Project. Within each of the three method sections, the students will, individually, write a short essay reporting on the mini project drawing on the relevant literature and lectures.

课程教师信息
Morten Frederiksen, (mfr@dps.aau.dk), Associate Professor, Department of Political Science, Aalborg University
Rasmus Juul Møberg (rjm@dps.aau.dk), Assistant Professor, Department of Sociology and Social Work, Aalborg University

课程编码：164MX002Z 英文名称：Government-Business Relations 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：余江

教学目的要求
The aim of the course is to provide students with insights into the relationships between government and business, such as, how governments at different levels impact on business practice, how businesses respond to and influence government policy, conflict and alignment of interests of government and businesses, and the changing role of national government in the globalization era.

预修课程

教材
Wilks, Stephen (2013) The Political Power of Business Corporation. Cheltenham, UK: Edward Elgar (note: chapters 1-3 & 8-9 of this book are required readings)

主要内容
This course is divided into three parts. In Part 1, we introduce three different lenses or perspectives for understanding the government and business relations, i.e., the boundary, interest, and power lenses. In Part 2, we discuss two specific topics that are associated with each of the three lenses, including: state-owned enterprises (SOE), corporate social responsibility (CSR), industrial policy, governance of innovation, intellectual property right (IPR) protection, corporate strategies for influencing government policy making, and supra-national governances and their impacts on businesses. In Part 3, we organize workshops and guest speeches.

课程编码：167MX002Z 英文名称：Analytical Biochemistry and Sample Preparation for Omics 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：娄晓敏等

教学目的要求
An Omics investigation is inevitably preceded by sample enrichment and purification based on the biochemical and/or physico-chemical properties of the group of molecules to be analysed. This purification is crucial, because an Omics experiment should only assay a defined group of molecules (e.g. DNA but not RNA); from a technical point it is important that samples do not contain impurities that can spoil instrumentation. Quite different purification concepts are required, because the groups of molecules subjected to an Omics study are highly diverse.This course will give theoretical and experimental insight into various enrichment and separation techniques employed in Omics studies, and outline the requirements for sample purification prior to the actual Omics analysis

预修课程

教材
Articles, reviews and handbooks which will be placed on Moddle during the semester.

主要内容
The theory behind methods used for separation and purification of RNA, DNA, proteins, peptides and metabolites will be covered, including methods based on affinity, hydrofobicity, polarity, charge and size:
1. Extraction and purification of proteins, RNA, DNA and metabolites from biological samples.
2. Chromatographic techniques
3. Electrophoretic techniques
4. Selective purification/enrichment for post-translational modifications
5. Labelling and quatitation in Proteomics
6. Sample preparation and data analysis in metabolomics
7. Sample preparation for lipidomics
8. Sample preparation for Genomics/Transcriptomics
9. Digestion of biomolecules
10. Interfacing chromatography with mass spectrometry

Practical laboratory work will include:
1. Reverse phase liquid chromatography
2. Gas chromatography
3. Lipid purification
4. Protein purification
5. Two-dimensional electrophoresis
6. MALDI peptide mass finger printing and MALDI MS/MS for identification; data analysis
7. Sample preparation for transcriptomics
8. Sample preparation for Genomics

传递过程

课程编码：165MX001Z 英文名称：Transport Processes 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
To introduce the participants to the modeling and numerical description of flow, heat and mass transport based on the fundamental equations of change.

A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
1. Describe the molecular processes behind viscosity, thermal conduction and diffusion
2. Obtain analytical solutions for flow problems with simple boundary and initial data
3. Formulate and analyze models for combined flow and heat transport
4. Formulate and analyze models for combined flow and diffusion
5. Formulate and analyze models for combined flow and chemical reaction
6. Do order of magnitude estimates for key quantities such as fluxes, reaction rates and equilibration times
7. Use CFD for the simulation of flow with combined heat and mass transport (COMSOL)
8. Evaluate the accuracy of approximations obtained by Computational Fluid Dynamics
9. Formulate models for transport with a small or large parameter (boundary layers)

预修课程

教材

主要内容
Mechanisms for the transport of momentum (flow), energy and mass in chemical and biological systems. Introduction to computational fluid dynamics (CFD) as basis for analysis and simulation of transport processes. Applications in the design of equipment and analytical instrumentation in the chemical, biotechnological and pharmaceutical industry.

参考文献
R. B. Bird, W. E. Stewart, E. N. Lightfoot: “Transport Phenomena”, Wiley, latest English language edition. Notes, problems, CFD exercises and projects uploaded on CampusNet.

课程教师信息
Professor Ole Hassager (responsible)
Associate Professor Peter Szabo
Associate Professor Stig Wedel

工业生物反应工程

课程编码：165MX002Z 英文名称：Industrial Bioreaction Engineering 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
The reactors used in the bio-industries are designed according to the same general principles as reactors elsewhere in the chemical industry. However, there are some quite specific characteristics of bio-reactions which require specialist treatment, e.g. the complex stoichiometry and thermodynamics. Using a quantitatively based approach, fermentation processes are analyzed with respect to scale-up and feasibility for the production of bio-based chemicals. Biochemistry, microbiology, sustainability and chemical engineering are all used to obtain a deeper insight into the complex world of bioreactions and their associated processes.

预修课程

教材
Bioreaction Engineering Principles, 3rd Edn, 2011, Jens Nielsen, John Villadsen and Gunnar Liden

主要内容
Role of fermentation in industrial manufacture of chemicals. Stoichiometry of cellular reactions, degree of reduction balances, yield coefficients and black box models. Evaluation of the feasibility of fermentation processes in an industrial context. Growth kinetics. Thermodynamics of bioreactions and heat balances. ATP balances and energetics. Scale-up and design of fermentation processes. Process evaluation project.

参考文献

课程教师信息
Professor John M Woodley

工业反应工程

课程编码：165MX003Z 英文名称：Industrial Reaction Engineering 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
To provide the students with a fundamental and practically applicable understanding of industrial important types of reactions and reactors that can be used in chemical and biochemical production processes and in pollution control.

预修课程

教材
Course notes, three home exercises, three course assignments.

主要内容
A major part of chemical reactions in production processes and in gas cleaning processes takes place in multi-phase reactors, e.g. Production of pharmaceuticals, calcination of lime in the production of calcium hydroxide, production of cement, combustion of solid and liquid fuels in the production of power and heat, catalytic and non-catalytic cleaning of flue gas and catalytic production of important products in different reactors including two or more phases. The examples are homogeneous or heterogeneous catalyzed, gassolid, gas-liquid, liquid-solid and gas-liquid-solid reactions that take place in a number of different reactor types (batch fixed bed, moving bed, spray absorbers, packed towers, membrane reactors, fluidized bed reactors, entrained flow reactors etc.). The theory covering the different types of reactions and a number of the reactors is expounded together with examples. During the semester the students cooperate in teams solving practical oriented reactor design problems.

参考文献

课程教师信息
Professor Kim Dam-Johansen (responsible)
Assistant Professor Hao Wu

生物炼制和生物燃料

课程编码：165MX004Z 英文名称：Biorefinery and Biofuels 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：罗建泉

教学目的要求
To provide the students with basic knowledge about the biorefinery concept and integrated processes that convert biomass into multiple products of bioenergy, biomaterials and biochemicals.

A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
1. Describe the physical and chemical structures of biomass and their potential use for production of bioenergy, biomaterials and biochemicals
2. Identify and describe biomass resources (forest, agricultural, municipal and marine biomass), their occurrence and application in a biorefinery concept
3. Identify and describe biomass constituents (starch, cellulose, hemicellulose, lignin, pectin, protein, lipids)
4. Outline the principles of a biorefinery including chemical, biological and thermo-chemical conversion methods
5. Outline and compare various methods of biomass processing for production of bioenergy products, biomaterials, chemicals and building blocks for chemical synthesis
6. Design a theoretical and creative biorefinery based on scientific references

预修课程

教材
The study material will be based on a compendium and international journal articles that will be uploaded on campusnet

主要内容
The course will give a broad perspective over the biorefinery concept by introducing the key integrated processes, such as biomass production, pretreatment, and chemical-, biological- and thermo-chemical- conversion. The lectures will focus on bioresources and single processing steps and will include industrial and scientific examples. In the case study the students will combine multiple processing steps into a novel biorefinery concept. There will be emphasis on sustainable systems throughout the course.

参考文献

课程教师信息

Associate Professor Jianquan Luo (assistant teacher)

课程编码：165MX010Z 英文名称：Technology, Economics, Management and Organization 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
The general purpose of the course is to qualify the student (1) to analyse an organisation from a strategic, tactical and operational perspective: (2) to define the strategy and the business model of a company; and (3) to understand how engineers contribute to the competitive advantage of a company.

A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
1. Identify and summarize key theories and models from the curriculum
2. Explain and describe business models, organizational design and management activities in a specific case
3. Apply theories and models from curriculum in a solution proposal for a specific problem and explain the relevance of the chosen theories and models
4. Analyze a specific case from a strategic, tactical and operational perspective
5. Formulate a synthesis including managerial, organizational and business perspectives in relation to a specific problem
6. Select organizational interventions and management activities from curriculum to support the implementation of a strategy in a company and make an argumentation for your selection
7. Outline the assumptions and preconditions of a specific problem and give an account of the consequences on the possible solution if these assumptions and preconditions are changed

预修课程

教材
Duncan Kitchin (2010): An introduction to organisational behaviour for managers and engineers.(Butterworth-Heinemann, ISBN: 978-0-7506-8334-0).
Alex Osterwalder (2010): Business Model Generation. (Wiley, ISBN: 978-2-8399-0580-0).
Additional notes and business cases will be distributed.

主要内容
The student will be introduced to theories and models of business design, management and organisation and to specific
issues such as planning, organising, leading, controlling, strategy, innovation, and business models.

课程编码：165MX013Z 英文名称：Combustion and High Temperature Processes 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
To provide the participants with a fundamental knowledge about combustion and other high temperature processes, including formation and reduction of harmful emissions.

A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
1. Set up mass and energy balances for combustion systems
2. Estimate flue gas amount and composition from stoichiometric calculations
3. Use simplified and detailed chemical models to estimate combustion rate and formation of pollutant species
4. Couple chemical and thermal analyses of reacting systems
5. Set up simplified conservation equations for reacting flows
6. Explain conceptual and practical differences between premixed and diffusion flames
7. Assess the impact of turbulence on combustion rates
8. Set up and use simplified model for droplet evaporation and combustion
9. Set up and use simplified model for particle heating and pyrolysis
10. Set up and use simplified model for char oxidation
11. Use the above tools together with numerical solvers to evaluate and optimize industrial hightemperature processes

预修课程

教材
Steve Turns: An Introduction to Combustion; notes

主要内容
The course is related to both chemical and mechanical engineering, as both of these types of engineers work with fuels and emissions. Topics covered include combustion of gaseous, liquid and solid fuels in different combustion systems such as gas turbines, motors, pulverized fuel combustors, fixed bed and fluid bed, as well as related industrial high temperature processes. The different systems are treated theoretically and the students solve larger, practically oriented problems during the course. For nonchemical engineers, introductory material is presented at the start of the course.

农业水分与养分管理

课程编码：161MX015Z 英文名称：Agricultural Water and Nutrients Management 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：崔骁勇等

教学目的要求
The objective of the course is to train the students within basic concepts of crop water relations, introduce possible strategies for efficient water and nutrients (mainly N and P) management in agro-ecosystems, which on one hand improve water and nutrients use efficiency in crop production and on the other hand mitigate the negative impacts of irrigation and fertilization on the environment. Students will obtain both theoretical and practical knowledge particularly on modelling tools to analyse nutrient cycles and losses from fields and farms.

预修课程

教材
Lectures, theoretical exercises and project work in combination with excursion comprising visits of different irrigation methods and long-term fertilization trials. Lectures are based on the textbook(s) used. The topics of the theoretical exercises run in parallel with the topics presented in the lectures. Each project is done by groups of students and it is presented as a report and an oral presentation.

主要内容
The course will give you in depth knowledge of the following subject areas:
1. Water dynamics in the soil-plant-atmosphere continuum (SPAC)
2. Water balance in the field and crop yield
3. Irrigation strategies
4. Plant nutrition functions, plant nutrient deficiency diagnosis
5. Soil fertility concepts, turnover of N and P in soil and effect on plant nutrient availability
6. Fertilization strategies and farming systems, methods to improve nutrient use efficiency, reduce N and P losses, improve crop yield and quality
7. Modelling water, N and P dynamics in the soil-plant systems and losses to the environment

中欧水法规、水资源经济与水资源政策

课程编码：161MX017Z 英文名称：Water Legislation, Economics and Policies in China and the European Union 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
The aim of this course is to provide an overview and understanding of water legislation, policy and planning in China and the EU. It includes an introduction to the main elements of water legislation in China and the EU, including Chinese terrestrial water resources law with a focus on the water quality management of lakes and rivers in China, as well as the EU Water Framework Directive and other relevant elements of EU water legislation.
The institutional set-up and main policy instruments in China and the EU will be introduced including implementation experiences and problems. Furthermore, the course will focus on different mechanisms and experiences regarding water planning and management in particular in a European context focusing on the implementation of the Water Framework Directive (WFD). Thereby it is made possible to learn of the advantages/disadvantages from the European experiences in a Chinese context.

预修课程

教材
N. Carter, 2007, The Politics of the Environment Ch. 7, pp. 173-181
EU, 2014: How the European Union works, pp. 1-25 (try to get an overview, you do not need to learn all the details)
C. McElwee: Environmental Law in China, Ch. 1 (pp. 1-9), Ch. 3 (pp. 32-50) (try to get an overview, you do not need to learn all the details)
GWP, IWRM – at a glance, pp. 1-8
Dajun Shen (2012) Water Quality Management in China, International Journal of Water Resources Development, 28:2, 281-297
Dajun Shen (2009): River basin water resources management in China: a legal and institutional assessment, Water International, 34:4, 484-496
W. Douma: European Environmental Law after Lisbon: an introduction, available at: http://www.asser.nl/default.aspx?site_id=7&level1=12219&level2=14663
L. Krämer: EU Environmental Law, 7th ed., 2012, Ch. 1 (pp. 15-27), Ch. 7 (pp. 251-273) (try to get an overview, you do not need to learn all the details)
N. Gunningham, Policy Instrument Choice and Diffuse Source Pollution, Journal of Environmental Law (2005) Vol 17/1 pp. 51-81
L. Dai, Tackling Diffuse Water Pollution from Agriculture in China, Utrecht Law Review (2014) vol 10 pp. 136-154
N. Carter, 2007, The Politics of the Environment, pp.321-52 (32 pp)
Kostka and Mol, 2013, “Implementation and Participation in China’s Local Environmental Politics: Challenges and Innovations” pp.3-12 in Journal of Environmental Policy and Planning vol.15 no.1. (10 pp)
European Environment Agency, 2013, Late lessons from early warnings: science, precaution, innovation, chapter 28 “In conclusion”, (13 pp)
N. Carter, 2007, The Politics of the Environment, pp.321-52 (32 pp)
Kostka and Mol, 2013, “Implementation and Participation in China’s Local Environmental Politics: Challenges and Innovations” pp.3-12 in Journal of Environmental Policy and Planning vol.15 no.1. (10 pp)
European Environment Agency, 2013, Late lessons from early warnings: science, precaution, innovation, chapter 28 “In conclusion”, (13 pp)
N. Carter, 2007, The Politics of the Environment, pp.321-52 (32 pp)
Kostka and Mol, 2013, “Implementation and Participation in China’s Local Environmental Politics: Challenges and Innovations” pp.3-12 in Journal of Environmental Policy and Planning vol.15 no.1. (10 pp)
European Environment Agency, 2013, Late lessons from early warnings: science, precaution, innovation, chapter 28 “In conclusion”, (13 pp)

主要内容
The main course elements comprise:
1. General introduction to water legislation in China and the EU
The challenge of sustainable management – why do we need to regulate the use of resources?
The institutional set-up and main pieces of water legislation in China as part of the evolving national water policy with a particular view to water quality.
The institutional set-up in the EU and the main elements of EU water policy and legislation with a particular focus on the EU Water Framework Directive and integrated water resource management.
2. Water policy and implementation
Policy instruments in general: Command-and-control-regulation, economic instruments, information/voluntary instruments. Pros and cons.
Implementation. Potential difficulties in fulfilling policy aims; potential obstacles during the implementation process – for instance at target group level and organizational level?
Water policy instruments– lessons from Europe. Primary focus will be on European experiences with economic policy instruments in water (currently analyzed in a European Union research project called ‘EPI Water’).
Evaluation of environmental policies.
3. Water planning
Spatial planning principles and water management
Top-down and bottom-up approaches in water management
Management challenges in common-pool resources (such as water)
Comprehensive cross-sectorial planning - policy integration in relation to water management

其它说明

课程名称: 基于子空间方法的时间序列分析与预测
英文名称: Subspace-based Methods for Analysing and Forecasting of Time Series
详细内容:
基于子空间方法的时间序列分析与预测

课程编码：011D9053Z* 英文名称：Subspace-based Methods for Analysing and Forecasting of Time Series 课时：30 学分：1.50 课程属性：其它 主讲教师：Anatoly Zhigljavsky

教学目的要求
In these course, the main ideas and the methodology will be explained of two closely related techniques, the so-called Singular-Spectrum Analysis (SSA) and the methodology which uses the low-rank approximation of structured matrices (abbreviated SLRA). The underlying models will be formulated and many variations of the methods will be shown. A very convenient and powerful software package Rssa, will be introduced and used throughout the course for analysing time series. There will be many real-life time series considered in order to demonstrate the capabilities of these methods and the Rssa package.
The new techniques will be compared with classical ARIMA-type techniques on many econometric time series.

预修课程

教材

主要内容
1. SSA and SLRA: general scheme; the main ideas and models.
2. Capabilities of the basic SSA methods
3. Introduction to the software package Rssa.
4. Analysing real-life time series for learning the main methods and their capabilities.
5. Introducing ESPRIT and other popular methods of signal processing; showing their place in the current methodology.
6. Singular-value decomposition (SVD) and different variations of the SVD for increasing separability of the components of the time series.
7. Use of different matrix norms in SSA and SLRA for increasing the accuracy of the analysis and forecasts.
8. Forecasting.
9. Use of Rssa for analysing and forecasting of econometric time series: practical work.
10. Comparison of SSA and SLRA with classical econometric techniques: practical work.
11. Imputation of missing values into time series.
12. Monitoring structural stability: main ideas and examples.
13. Mutivariate time series and analysis of causality.
14. Image processing and other potential applications of SSA and SLRA.

课程名称: 水文学，淡水生态学及生物地球化学
详细内容:
水文学，淡水生态学及生物地球化学

课程编码：161MX001Z 英文名称：Hydrology, Freshwater Ecology and Biogeochemistry 课时：200 学分：8.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：宋献方等

教学目的要求
The objectives of the course are:
1. To learn how the hydrological cycle is working and of what components it consists, to learn physical hydrological equations and how measurements and sensors are relevant in modeling approaches used to estimate components in the hydrological cycle
2. To learn how freshwater systems function in respect to biological, physical and chemical aspects, to get insight in how microbial loops are part of freshwater systems, and to understand freshwater systems are affected by human impact and catchments
3. To learn how elements distribute between the different spheres, to get an overview of which biogeochemical processes govern distribution, transfers and transformations of the elements, to describe the interactions between the cycles of the different most important elements in different ecosystems, and to learn how human activities perturb the biogeochemical cycles at a global scale

预修课程

教材
1. George M. Hornberger, Patricia L. Wiberg , Jeffrey P. Raffensperger and Paolo D’Odorico (2014). Elements of Physical Hydrology, 2nd edition. John Hopkins University Press. ISBN-13: 978-1421413730 (the recommended text book)
Other useful books:
2. Elizabeth M. Shaw, Keith J. Beven, Nick A. Chappell, Rob Lamb (2011): Hydrology in Practice, Fourth Edition, Spon Press, Oxon, UK. This book is available for sale at the DTU bookshop.
3. W. Brutsaert (2005), Hydrology an Introduction, Cambridge University Press, Cambridge
4. Chow, V. T., et al. (1988), Applied Hydrology, McGraw-Hill, New York
5. Dingman, S. L. (2002), Physical Hydrology (2nd. Ed.), Prentice Hall, New Jersey
6. Fetter, C. W. (2001), Applied Hydrogeology, 4th ed., Prentice Hall, New Jersey
7. Margulis, S., 2014: Introduction to Hydrology, 414pp. (open-access multimedia electronic textbook); http://aqua.seas.ucla.edu/margulis_intro_to_hydro_textbook.html
8. Allan, J.D. 1995: Stream Ecology – Structure and function of running waters, Chapman and Hall, New York 1995.
9. Wetzel R. G. 2001: Limnology: Lake and River Ecosystems, 3rd Edition, Elsewier, Academic Press
10. Schlesinger, W.H; Bernhardt, E. (2013) Biogeochemistry. An analysis of global change. 3rd Ed. Acad. Press, 688 pages (selected chapters).

主要内容
The Hydrological module consists of lectures in combination with practical tutorials and assignments with real world hydrological problems. Notes, lecture slides and supporting material will be provided.
The Freshwater Ecology and the Biogeochemistry module consist of lectures in combination with colloquiums including student presentations and discussions and calculation exercises. Besides field sampling will be demonstrated and exercises will be performed to test the methodologies learned.

课程教师信息

脊椎动物骨骼学

课程编码：620010H 英文名称：Vertebrates Osteology 课时：80 学分：5.00 课程属性：专业核心课 主讲教师：倪喜军等

教学目的要求
本课程为古生物学与地层学（含古人类学）、地球生物学研究生的专业基础课，同时面向动物学、生态学、进化生物学等专业的研究生。本课程讲授脊椎动物各类群的主要成员以及主要骨骼特征，让学生对脊椎动物的形态多样性、演化过程有直观的认识，为学生进一步开展古脊椎动物学、古人类学、进化生物学工作打下坚实的基础。

预修课程
普通生物学

教材

主要内容
第一讲 古生代鱼形类
介绍古生代的主要类群（甲胄鱼，棘鱼、盾皮鱼、软骨鱼、硬骨鱼）的主要特征以及关系。
第二讲 中新生代鱼类
介绍中新生代的鱼类
第三讲 基干四足动物
介绍离片椎类、壳椎类、石炭蜥、西蒙螈、无孔类、非哺乳的下孔类、龟鳖类等类群
第四讲 滑体两栖动物以及鳞龙形类
介绍蛙、蝾螈、楔齿蜥、蜥蜴、蛇等类群
第五讲 主龙类简介
介绍三叠纪的类群以及鳄形类
第六讲 恐龙
介绍恐龙（蜥臀类与鸟臀类）的主要类群，不包括鸟类
第七讲 鸟类
介绍化石鸟类以及现代鸟类
第八讲 翼龙及海生爬行动物
介绍翼龙、鱼龙、鳍龙等类群
第九讲 早期哺乳动物
介绍中生代的哺乳动物
第十讲 新生代哺乳动物
介绍新生代的哺乳动物

参考文献
Vertebrate Paleontology Benton, 2005

课程教师信息

心理多元统计分析

课程编码：142M2003H 英文名称：Multivariate Statistic Analysis for Psychology 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科普及课 主讲教师：陈毅文

教学目的要求
本课程为心理学学科硕士研究生的学科基础课，也可作为其他学科研究生的选修课。
通过本课程的学习，使学生理解和掌握心理多元统计中基本概念，基本原理，每种统计方法的适用条件和应用技巧，并能借助专业统计软件在计算机上实现。

预修课程

教材

主要内容
内容提要：
第一章 矩阵代数
矩阵的运算；矩阵的逆；矩阵的秩；行列式；特征值；特征向量。
第二章 随机向量及其分布
一元分布；多元分布；多元正态分布；协方差矩阵；相关矩阵。
第三章 统计学基础知识的回顾
统计数据的整理与描述；几种重要的概率分布；参数估计；假设检验。
第四章 多元方差分析
一元方差分析与多元方差分析的关系；多元方差分析的数据要求和假设条件；单因素二元模型；双因素二元饱和模型；双因素二元非饱和模型。
第五章 多元线性回归
一元线性回归模型；最小二乘法；多元线性回归模型；回归方程和回归系数的推断统计；回归预测的区间估计；多重共线性及其解决方法；虚拟变量的应用。
第六章 典型相关分析
典型相关分析的基本假设和数据要求；典型相关系数；典型系数；特征值；典型负荷系数；冗余指数。
第七章 因素分析
因素分析原理；主成分分析法；共因子分析法；因素旋转；一些基本概念。
第八章 聚类分析
聚类分析的主要步骤；相关测度；距离测度；关联测度；层次聚类法；迭代聚类法。
第九章 判别分析
判别分析的假设条件；基本模型；非标准化判别系数；标准化判别系数；结构系数；组中心；判别力指数；Fisher判别系数。
第十章 结构方程模型
模型的设定；模型的识别；模型的估计；模型的评价；模型的修正。

参考文献
主要参考书：
1．郭志刚，《社会统计分析方法》，中国人民大学出版社，北京，1999。
2．张敏强，《教育与心理统计学》，人民教育出版社，北京，1993。

课程教师信息

认知心理学

课程编码：142M4001H 英文名称：Cognitive Psychology 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：专业核心课 主讲教师：蒋毅等

教学目的要求

预修课程

教材

主要内容
教学目的、要求 ：
本课程为心理学学科研究生的学科专业课。认知心理学是以信息加工观点为核心的心理学。本课程主要内容为基于信息加工理论的心理学理论和研究方法及其发展方向，并讲授认知心理学和认知神经科学的研究成果。通过本课程学习，希望学生掌握认知心理学和认知神经科学的基本理论和研究方法，熟悉认知心理学的发展方向。

预修课程 : 普通心理学、心理学研究方法

内容提要：
第一章 认知心理学导论 （3学时，教师:李雪冰）
认知心理学的起源；基本观点；认知的神经基础；与相关学科的关系；未来发展方向。

第二章 认知神经科学研究方法（12学时，教师：蒋毅、李雪冰、杨志、张弢）
认知神经科学的研究方法；心理物理、ERP、fMRI、神经电生理技术及其应用；实验设计与数据分析方法。

第三章 感知觉 （3学时，教师：张弢）
感觉编码；视觉、听觉、嗅觉、多通道知觉；运动控制、脑机接口。

第四章 客体识别 （3学时，教师：张弢）
视知觉的两条皮质通路、初中级视觉加工过程；客体识别（高级视觉加工过程）。

第五章 注意 （3学时，教师：蒋毅）
注意和意识；注意理论；集中注意；注意分配；自动化加工；注意的神经机制。

第六章 记忆 （3学时，教师：李雪冰）
记忆结构；记忆的理论；短时记忆与长时记忆；语义记忆与情节记忆；外显记忆与内隐记忆；记忆的神经基础。

第七章 知识的表征 （3学时，教师：李雪冰）
长时记忆系统和表征；知识表征的各种观点；语义知识和情景知识的表征；程序性知识的表征；图式、框架和脚本。

第八章 表象 （3学时，教师：付秋芳）
表象；视觉失认症；双重编码理论；图优效应；心理选转；心理扫描；距离效应；大小效应；认知地图；表象与知觉的关系；表象对学习记忆等的作用。

第九章 决策与推理（3学时，教师：李雪冰）
决策框架；不确定条件下的决策；前景理论；决策的生态理性观；神经经济学；演绎推理；归纳推理；推理的机制。

第十章 概念与类别 （3学时，教师：付秋芳）
概念；概念的类别；概念的组织；概念的形成；假设检验；定义属性理论；原型理论；样例理论；类别学习；类别学习多重系统理论；范畴特异性语义缺失。

第十一章 问题解决与创造性（3学时，教师：杨志）
问题解决的假说；问题解决策略；影响问题解决的因素；创造性。

第十二章 情绪 （3学时，教师：李雪冰）
情绪的概念；情绪理论；情绪的诱导与测量；情绪的神经基础；心境与认知关系的理论。

第十三章 语言 （3学时，教师：付秋芳）
语言习得理论；音素重建效应；心理词典；语言理解；阅读广度；语法与语义的关系；语言产生；失语症；扩散激活理论；双语及其类型；语言与认知的关系。

第十四章 元认知与意识 （3学时，教师：付秋芳）
元认知；元记忆；学习判断；最近学习区；自我意识；意识的隐喻；内隐学习；内隐记忆；启动效应；阈下知觉；意识的脑机制；意识的理论；意识的功能。

第十五章 认知发展（3学时，教师：杨志）
认知发展的理论观点；不同领域的认知发展特点；认知的毕生发展；发展认知神经科学。

第十六章 社会认知（3学时，教师：李雪冰）
社会知觉、自我与他人、社会关系、社会知识、社会认知神经科学。


闭卷考试（3学时）

课程教师信息

心理评估

课程编码：142M2002H 英文名称：Psychological Assessment 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科普及课 主讲教师：陈天勇

教学目的要求
教学目的和要求：
本课程为心理学学科硕士研究生的学科基础课。心理评估是心理学方法论中重要组成部分，包括了心理测量学、心理测验学、个案分析法等基本心理学工具。本课程将介绍心理评估的理论背景、发展历史及其现状，并介绍心理测量、心理测验等的基本原理和操作方法。
通过本课的学习，学生将能够了解心理评估各个组成部分的基本原理和操作方法，了解心理评估方法与其它心理学研究方法之间的区别与联系，并能将心理评估应用于实际生活情景中。

预修课程

教材

主要内容
内容提要：
第一章 心理学评估的意义和演变
心理学评估的渊源；心理学评估的定义：科学还是艺术？现在心理学评估的范畴和基型。
第二章 心理评估者
心理评估者及其角色；心理评估者的角色知觉；心理学评估中的伦理问题。
第三章 心理学评估的相关因素
心理学评估的哲学/科学基础；对人格和精神病学的新的理解；信度/效度：怎样的心理学评估是理想的？临床和统计预测：两种心理学评估路向的效度；心理学评估中的经济因素；心理学评估的社会因素。
第四章 心理学评估的测量传统
心理测量学概念；与心理测量学有关的特殊问题。
第五章 心理学评估的临床传统
测量与临床传统：相异与相同之处；临床传统的近代发展和现状。
第六章 心理学测验（1）：智力和神经心理评价
智力测验；神经心理评估。
第七章 心理学测验（2）：人格测验与投射技术
人格问卷；投射技术；心理学评估的其它工具：观察、会谈和分类系统。
第八章 心理评估过程
评估过程的概念化模式；个案分析的途径；心理学评估报告的内容。

参考文献
主要参考书：
Murphy, K. R., Davidshofer, C. O., Psychological Testing: Principles and Application, Prentice hall，Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey, 1991.

教学目的要求

预修课程

教材

主要内容
传统医药学以其独特的理论体系、丰富的医疗实践、卓越的临床疗效，为人类的健康事业做出了巨大贡献。面对由医疗实践与传统文化等共同构成的传统医学体系，人们的解读与分析往往莫衷一是。本课程将培养学习者从科学、技术、社会、文化等多个角度认知传统医学的方法与能力，加深对中国传统医学的哲学观、身体观、疾病观、诊查观与防治观的理解，提高分析与解决传统医学中若干问题的能力，从而能够较好地从医学与文化等角度较为公允、全面、客观地认识传统医学与文化之间的关系，开拓研究视野，提升科研能力，培育文化素养。

科学的拉丁语

课程编码：144M2027H 英文名称：Scientific Latin 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科普及课 主讲教师：佐佐木力

教学目的要求

预修课程

教材

主要内容
It was through Clavius’s 1574 Latin edition of Euclid’s Elements that Matteo Ricci and Xu Guangqi 徐光啓made their Chinese translation 《幾何原本》, which was published in Beijing in 1607. And the foremost classic of scientific books first published in 1687, Newton’s Principia mathematica philosophicae naturalis《自然哲学之数学原理》, was written in Latin. Thus, the Latin language is very important in the formative period of European modern mathematics and sciences.
This introductive course of scientific Latin will be taught by Prof. Sasaki, expert of early modern European mathematics. He will teach this course by using the textbook in English James Morwood’s Latin Grammar (Oxford University Press, 1999). Students taking this course will be given this book or its copy with free charge.
Students of the history of science are encouraged to take this course. It will be organized and taught so that almost all the classes can be understood without any preparations and that only participation in classes may be sufficient.
The grading of students will be made by the rate of their participations in classes.

课程教师信息

世界数学史要论

课程编码：144M2011H 英文名称：World History of Mathematics 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科普及课 主讲教师：佐佐木力

教学目的要求

预修课程

教材

主要内容
For the fall semester of the academic year 2014-2015, Prof. Sasaki offers a general course on ”An Essential History of Mathematics in the World,” much revised and more specific version of the previous course on ”An Essential History of Science and Technology in West” of the fall semester of 2013.

Prof. Sasaki’s main field in the history and philosophy of science is the history of mathematics in early modern Europe. This course will include not only Western mathematics but also Chinese and Japanese mathematics, and doesn’t intend to be mathematically technical.

Prof. Sasaki’s course will teach an essential history of mathematics in the world, but, special emphases will be put on the emergence of rigorously demonstrated and axiomatic mathematics of ancient Greece, mathematical thought during the Scientific Revolution of 17th-century Europe, Analytical Revolution along the Second Scientific Revolution in 19th-century Europe, and the contemporary philosophy of mathematics in comparison with the history of mathematics in traditional China and Japan. An explanation on the transformation of mathematical system in modern Chinese and Japan will be also provided. Students studying the history of science in China who don’t consider themselves to be good at mathematical sciences are encouraged to take this course.

The grading of students will be made by a report at the end of this course as well as the rate of participation of students in the classes. The details of this course will be explained at the first class in September 15.



1. September 15 (Monday): What Are Mathematics and Science?

2. September 17 (Wednesday): How to Study the History of Mathematics?

3. September 22 (Monday): Two Archetypes of Mathematical Thought: Ancient Greece and Ancient China
